definition: all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

sentences.english: Ferguson once derided the modern-day City as being "all talk".
sentences.chinese: 弗格森曾經嘲笑這支曼城隊“光說不做”。

sentences.english: A man of words but not deeds is like a garden full of weeds.
sentences.chinese: 一個人光說不做，就像是花園裏面到處是雜草。

sentences.english: His trouble is that he's all mouth.
Jim won't do it. He's just all talk.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆不會去做的，他總是光說不做。

sentences.english: Their trouble was that they were all mouth and trousers.
sentences.chinese: 他們的毛病是光說不做。

sentences.english: Talk will avail little without work.
A man with words not dees is like a garden full of weeds.
sentences.chinese: 光說不做的人就像花園長滿刺。

sentences.english: It is no use talking without doing.
